xml.e: [div class="huge"]Jatā Sutta[/div][p]A deva asks the Buddha how sentient beings can escape from their tangles. By the destruction of rāga, dosa, moha, answers the Buddha. [/p][p]This sutta forms the basis of the Visuddhi-Magga. S.i.13; repeated at i.165.[/p]

[div class="huge"]Jatā-Bhāradvāja[/div] [p]A brahmin of the [a href="javascript:void(0)" onclick="DPPNXML('dppn/b/bhaaradvaaja,Bhāradvājagotta')"]Bhāradvājagotta[/a]. [/p] [p]He goes to the [a href="javascript:void(0)" onclick="DPPNXML('dppn/b/buddha,Buddha')"]Buddha[/a] and asks him the questions given in the [a href="javascript:void(0)" onclick="DPPNXML('dppn/j/jataa_s,Jatā Sutta')"]Jatā Sutta[/a]. The Buddha gives the same answer (S.i.165). [/p] [p]The Commentary (SA.i.179) says that he was given this name by the Recensionists because he asked a question about jatā (tangle).[/p]

[div class="huge"]Rāmaneyyaka Sutta[/div][p]Sakka visits the Buddha at Jetavana and asks him what it is which, by situation, is enjoyable. The Buddha replies that whatever place is occupied by the arahants that is the most enjoyable. S.i.232; cp. DhA.ii.195; the verse here ascribed to the Buddha is, in the Thag. (vs. 991) attributed to Sāriputta. Both there and in DhA. (see above) the verse is uttered in reference to Sāriputta's brother, Revata.[/p]
